description: Modifies an existing Amazon Managed Grafana workspace. If you use this operation and omit any optional parameters, the existing values of those parameters are not changed. To modify the user authentication methods that the workspace uses, such as SAML or IAM Identity Center, use UpdateWorkspaceAuthentication. To modify which users in the workspace have the Admin and Editor Grafana roles, use UpdatePermissions.

parameters.name: networkAccessControl
parameters.description: The configuration settings for network access to your workspace. When this is configured, only listed IP addresses and VPC endpoints will be able to access your workspace. Standard Grafana authentication and authorization will still be required. If this is not configured, or is removed, then all IP addresses and VPC endpoints will be allowed. An array of prefix list IDs. A prefix list is a list of CIDR ranges of IP addresses. The IP addresses specified are allowed to access your workspace. If the list is not included in the configuration (passed an empty array) then no IP addresses are allowed to access the workspace. You create a prefix list using the Amazon VPC console. Prefix list IDs have the format ``pl-1a2b3c4d ``. For more information about prefix lists, see `Group CIDR blocks using managed prefix lists <https://docs.aws.amazon.com/vpc/latest/userguide/managed-prefix-lists.html>`__in the Amazon Virtual Private Cloud User Guide. (string) --- An array of Amazon VPC endpoint IDs for the workspace. You can create VPC endpoints to your Amazon Managed Grafana workspace for access from within a VPC. If a NetworkAccessConfiguration is specified then only VPC endpoints specified here are allowed to access the workspace. If you pass in an empty array of strings, then no VPCs are allowed to access the workspace. VPC endpoint IDs have the format ``vpce-1a2b3c4d ``. For more information about creating an interface VPC endpoint, see Interface VPC endpoints in the Amazon Managed Grafana User Guide. (string) ---

nested_params.name: prefixListIds
nested_params.description: An array of prefix list IDs. A prefix list is a list of CIDR ranges of IP addresses. The IP addresses specified are allowed to access your workspace. If the list is not included in the configuration (passed an empty array) then no IP addresses are allowed to access the workspace. You create a prefix list using the Amazon VPC console. Prefix list IDs have the format ``pl-1a2b3c4d ``. For more information about prefix lists, see `Group CIDR blocks using managed prefix lists <https://docs.aws.amazon.com/vpc/latest/userguide/managed-prefix-lists.html>`__in the Amazon Virtual Private Cloud User Guide.

nested_params.name: vpceIds
nested_params.description: An array of Amazon VPC endpoint IDs for the workspace. You can create VPC endpoints to your Amazon Managed Grafana workspace for access from within a VPC. If a NetworkAccessConfiguration is specified then only VPC endpoints specified here are allowed to access the workspace. If you pass in an empty array of strings, then no VPCs are allowed to access the workspace. VPC endpoint IDs have the format ``vpce-1a2b3c4d ``. For more information about creating an interface VPC endpoint, see Interface VPC endpoints in the Amazon Managed Grafana User Guide.

parameters.name: permissionType
parameters.description: Use this parameter if you want to change a workspace from SERVICE_MANAGED to CUSTOMER_MANAGED. This allows you to manage the permissions that the workspace uses to access datasources and notification channels. If the workspace is in a member Amazon Web Services account of an organization, and that account is not a delegated administrator account, and you want the workspace to access data sources in other Amazon Web Services accounts in the organization, you must choose CUSTOMER_MANAGED. If you specify this as CUSTOMER_MANAGED, you must also specify a workspaceRoleArn that the workspace will use for accessing Amazon Web Services resources. For more information on the role and permissions needed, see Amazon Managed Grafana permissions and policies for Amazon Web Services data sources and notification channels.

parameters.name: removeNetworkAccessConfiguration
parameters.description: Whether to remove the network access configuration from the workspace. Setting this to true and providing a networkAccessControl to set will return an error. If you remove this configuration by setting this to true, then all IP addresses and VPC endpoints will be allowed. Standard Grafana authentication and authorization will still be required.

parameters.name: removeVpcConfiguration
parameters.description: Whether to remove the VPC configuration from the workspace. Setting this to true and providing a vpcConfiguration to set will return an error.

parameters.name: vpcConfiguration
parameters.description: The configuration settings for an Amazon VPC that contains data sources for your Grafana workspace to connect to. The list of Amazon EC2 security group IDs attached to the Amazon VPC for your Grafana workspace to connect. Duplicates not allowed. (string) --- The list of Amazon EC2 subnet IDs created in the Amazon VPC for your Grafana workspace to connect. (string) ---

nested_params.name: securityGroupIds
nested_params.description: The list of Amazon EC2 security group IDs attached to the Amazon VPC for your Grafana workspace to connect. Duplicates not allowed.

nested_params.name: subnetIds
nested_params.description: The list of Amazon EC2 subnet IDs created in the Amazon VPC for your Grafana workspace to connect. Duplicates not allowed.

parameters.name: workspaceDataSources
parameters.description: This parameter is for internal use only, and should not be used. (string) ---

parameters.name: workspaceId
parameters.description: The ID of the workspace to update.

parameters.name: workspaceNotificationDestinations
parameters.description: Specify the Amazon Web Services notification channels that you plan to use in this workspace. Specifying these data sources here enables Amazon Managed Grafana to create IAM roles and permissions that allow Amazon Managed Grafana to use these channels. (string) ---

parameters.name: workspaceOrganizationalUnits
parameters.description: Specifies the organizational units that this workspace is allowed to use data sources from, if this workspace is in an account that is part of an organization. (string) ---

nested_items.name: workspace
nested_items.description: A structure containing data about the workspace that was created.

nested_items.name: accountAccessType
nested_items.description: Specifies whether the workspace can access Amazon Web Services resources in this Amazon Web Services account only, or whether it can also access Amazon Web Services resources in other accounts in the same organization. If this is ORGANIZATION, the workspaceOrganizationalUnits parameter specifies which organizational units the workspace can access.

nested_items.name: authentication
nested_items.description: A structure that describes whether the workspace uses SAML, IAM Identity Center, or both methods for user authentication.

nested_items.name: providers
nested_items.description: Specifies whether the workspace uses SAML, IAM Identity Center, or both methods for user authentication.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: samlConfigurationStatus
nested_items.description: Specifies whether the workplace's user authentication method is fully configured.

nested_items.name: created
nested_items.description: The date that the workspace was created.

nested_items.name: dataSources
nested_items.description: Specifies the Amazon Web Services data sources that have been configured to have IAM roles and permissions created to allow Amazon Managed Grafana to read data from these sources.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: description
nested_items.description: The user-defined description of the workspace.

nested_items.name: endpoint
nested_items.description: The URL that users can use to access the Grafana console in the workspace.

nested_items.name: freeTrialConsumed
nested_items.description: Specifies whether this workspace has already fully used its free trial for Grafana Enterprise.

nested_items.name: freeTrialExpiration
nested_items.description: If this workspace is currently in the free trial period for Grafana Enterprise, this value specifies when that free trial ends.

nested_items.name: grafanaToken
nested_items.description: The token that ties this workspace to a Grafana Labs account. For more information, see Link your account with Grafana Labs.

nested_items.name: grafanaVersion
nested_items.description: The version of Grafana supported in this workspace.

nested_items.name: id
nested_items.description: The unique ID of this workspace.

nested_items.name: licenseExpiration
nested_items.description: If this workspace has a full Grafana Enterprise license purchased through Amazon Web Services Marketplace, this specifies when the license ends and will need to be renewed. Purchasing the Enterprise plugins option through Amazon Managed Grafana does not have an expiration. It is valid until the license is removed.

nested_items.name: licenseType
nested_items.description: Specifies whether this workspace has a full Grafana Enterprise license.

nested_items.name: modified
nested_items.description: The most recent date that the workspace was modified.

nested_items.name: name
nested_items.description: The name of the workspace.

nested_items.name: networkAccessControl
nested_items.description: The configuration settings for network access to your workspace.

nested_items.name: prefixListIds
nested_items.description: An array of prefix list IDs. A prefix list is a list of CIDR ranges of IP addresses. The IP addresses specified are allowed to access your workspace. If the list is not included in the configuration (passed an empty array) then no IP addresses are allowed to access the workspace. You create a prefix list using the Amazon VPC console.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: vpceIds
nested_items.description: An array of Amazon VPC endpoint IDs for the workspace. You can create VPC endpoints to your Amazon Managed Grafana workspace for access from within a VPC. If a NetworkAccessConfiguration is specified then only VPC endpoints specified here are allowed to access the workspace. If you pass in an empty array of strings, then no VPCs are allowed to access the workspace.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: notificationDestinations
nested_items.description: The Amazon Web Services notification channels that Amazon Managed Grafana can automatically create IAM roles and permissions for, to allow Amazon Managed Grafana to use these channels.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: organizationRoleName
nested_items.description: The name of the IAM role that is used to access resources through Organizations.

nested_items.name: organizationalUnits
nested_items.description: Specifies the organizational units that this workspace is allowed to use data sources from, if this workspace is in an account that is part of an organization.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: permissionType
nested_items.description: If this is SERVICE_MANAGED, and the workplace was created through the Amazon Managed Grafana console, then Amazon Managed Grafana automatically creates the IAM roles and provisions the permissions that the workspace needs to use Amazon Web Services data sources and notification channels.

nested_items.name: stackSetName
nested_items.description: The name of the CloudFormation stack set that is used to generate IAM roles to be used for this workspace.

nested_items.name: status
nested_items.description: The current status of the workspace.
(string) ---
(string) ---

nested_items.name: vpcConfiguration
nested_items.description: The configuration for connecting to data sources in a private VPC (Amazon Virtual Private Cloud).

nested_items.name: securityGroupIds
nested_items.description: The list of Amazon EC2 security group IDs attached to the Amazon VPC for your Grafana workspace to connect. Duplicates not allowed.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: subnetIds
nested_items.description: The list of Amazon EC2 subnet IDs created in the Amazon VPC for your Grafana workspace to connect. Duplicates not allowed.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: workspaceRoleArn
nested_items.description: The IAM role that grants permissions to the Amazon Web Services resources that the workspace will view data from. This role must already exist.
